relation: I always see campus security staff in the parking lot and around campus which makes me feel safe, especially at night.

Catch 22 across the street is a bar/restaurant. There are also many on campus events such as concerts put on by the PVCC band and plays by the theater department, as well as a few film festivals throughout the year.
The staff is pretty friendly in the cafe and the food is standard cafeteria style. Not great, but not bad either with several options available.

It all depends on the professors. I have had some classes (especially Chem & Bio courses) that have been higher level of difficulty. Most of the humanities type courses are fun and easier on your brain!
See a counselor to insure you stay on track with your degree progress. Look into the many transfer programs available through state universities known as the Mapp program.

The campus is clean and neat. There are great professors and guidance counselors available to help you throughout your college studies. There are many opportunities to transfer to a major University through your coursework at PVCC.
pageTitle: Paradise Valley Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {82756=My number one tip would be to have all items needed to start classes August 18Th turned in BEFORE their deadlines, this in order to not be caught up in the stress of turning in things the day they are due, which becomes pretty stressful at this school if your put in that position. I would just keep up to date with deadlines on the schools website and by calling the school to make sure of deadline dates in case there had been changes. Don't be afraid to make sure of anything and everything!, 261515=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Campus Safety campus safety is like a life guard anything you need they will be their from jump starting your car to a lost memory chip. Greek Life haven't experienced. Clubs and Activities their are dance clubs, drama, hiking, christian, study, art anything you can really think of its here.. Great for these types of students great for young students and adults.attending a community college allows more freedom and flexibility . many students at a community colleges have kids and jobs like many at universities might, yet the flexible hours and smaller classes allow better interaction among professor's and students. Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus at pvcc their is a tradition with barbecues. every time their is a set up of clubs trying to recruit or a big announcement their will be food involved. What to do for fun i like going to the soccer games with some friends after having a long study session in the library. Food and Dining the food verity is great. a very wide
